page.title: 09Alan a farmer
page.content: Alan has been farming at East Monkton farm for 18 years.He has help running the farm from his father and brother.The farm has been in the family for 38 years.Previously it had belonged to a Mr.Thomas.It is a cereal and beef farm.Alan owns 60 beef cattle which are Hereford Cross. The farm is 222acres of which 135 are under crops.He grows barley,winter wheat,potatoes and grass.The grass is for grazing,hay or sileage. In May and June Alan is up at 7 checking the cattle;breakfast at 8, then he checks and greases the machinery ready for gathering the sileage.He uses a forage harvester to cut and throw the grass into a trailer.The grass is emptied on to a concrete base,piled using a buck rake and covered with a plastic sheet anchored with old tyres.All over by 9.
